title: Understanding DCOUNT
text: The DCOUNT function is used in databases to perform a specific type of counting operation. It is not just a simple count of all entries.

title: Focus on Numeric Entries
text: DCOUNT specifically deals with numeric entries. Consider what kind of operation it performs on these entries.

title: Condition-Based Counting
text: The DCOUNT function counts entries that meet a certain condition or test. Think about what this implies for its operation.

hintAnswer: counts the number of numeric entries in a table field that pass a test
title: Identify the Correct Function
text: Which of the following best describes the DCOUNT function?
choices: calculates average of numbers in a table field that pass a test
counts the number of numeric entries in a table field that pass a test
adds each element that passes the test, and counts them
